step 1.S: In a mixing bowl, combine flour(s), salt, sugar, sourdough starter, olive oil and water. Mix with a wooden spoon until loosely combined, then tip onto a clean, dry surface and knead vigorously for 5 minutes until you have a smooth ball of elastic dough.

step 2.S: Lightly oil the mixing bowl and place the dough in it. Cover with aluminum foil or place in a plastic bag and let rise overnight. Once it is doubled in volume, transfer to a fridge to stop over-proofing.

step 3.S: When you are ready to bake the breads, preheat oven to the highest setting (500F).

step 4.S: Divide dough into 8 equal portions (use kitchen scales to weight the eight lumps of dough, ensuring they all weigh more or less the same). If you have a pizza stone, preheat it now. If not, preheat a thick baking sheet.

step 5.S: Lightly dust the work surface with flour and roll two of the balls into an oval shape, not too thin, not too thick. Leave them to rest for a few mins while the oven heats up.

step 6.S: When the oven is piping hot, place a couple of breads onto the pizza stone/baking sheet as quickly as you can so as not to let too much heat out of the oven.

step 7.S: Bake for about three to five minutes each, until they have puffed up like a pillow and are barely colored â€“ just a shade of brown at the edge, perhaps.

step 8.S: When they are done, lift out with tongs and place on a wire rack to cool. Continue until you have used up all the dough balls.

step 9.S: You may be able to bake more than two at once, depending on the size of your pizza stone/tray/oven.
